SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class Gameplay

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.Gameplay
public class Gameplay extends Object
The `Gameplay` class represents the gameplay logic of the game. It manages the game state, players, turns, and actions performed during the game.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Gameplay(GameMode gameMode, int numPlayers, int gameID)
    Create a `Gameplay` instance with the specified game mode, number of players, and game ID.

  • Constructor Details

    • Gameplay

      public Gameplay(GameMode gameMode, int numPlayers, int gameID) throws NumPlayersException, GameModeException
      Create a `Gameplay` instance with the specified game mode, number of players, and game ID.
      Parameters:
      gameMode - game mode.
      numPlayers - number of players.
      gameID - game ID.
      Throws:
      NumPlayersException - if the number of players is invalid.
      GameModeException - if the game mode is invalid.

  • Method Details

    • addPlayer

      public Player addPlayer(String name) throws GameFullException, NameAlreadyExistentException
      Adds a player to the game with the specified name. For the unicity of the id, if a player join with a name, is not possible for others players to join with the same name, also if the player has left the game in the waiting phase.
      Parameters:
      name - name of the player to add.
      Returns:
      created `Player` object.
      Throws:
      GameFullException - if the game is already full.
      NameAlreadyExistentException - if the player name already exists.

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Starts the game. No checks if the correct number of player has been reached.

    • pickItem

      public void pickItem(Coordinates coordinates) throws NotLinearPickException, LimitReachedPickException, NotCatchablePickException, EmptySlotPickException, OutOfBoardPickException
      Picks an item from the living room.
      Parameters:
      coordinates - The coordinates of the item to pick.
      Throws:
      NotLinearPickException - If the pick is not linear.
      LimitReachedPickException - If the pick limit is reached.
      NotCatchablePickException - If the item cannot be caught.
      EmptySlotPickException - If the slot is empty.
      OutOfBoardPickException - If the pick is out of the board.

    • releaseHand

      public void releaseHand()
      Releases the hand by putting back the picked items in the board. If the hand is empty, nothing happen.

    • selectOrderHand

      public void selectOrderHand(ArrayList<Integer> list) throws WrongLengthOrderException, WrongContentOrderException
      Selects the order in which the items from the hand will be placed in the library.
      Parameters:
      list - The list representing the order of items.
      Throws:
      WrongLengthOrderException - If the length of the order list is incorrect.
      WrongContentOrderException - If the content of the order list is incorrect.

    • putItemList

      public void putItemList(int column) throws EmptyHandException, InvalidColumnPutException, NotEnoughSpacePutException
      Puts the items from the hand into the specified column of the player's library.
      Parameters:
      column - column index where the items will be put.
      Throws:
      EmptyHandException - If the hand is empty.
      InvalidColumnPutException - If the specified column is invalid.
      NotEnoughSpacePutException - If there is not enough space in the column to put the items.

    • endTurn

      public void endTurn()
      Ends the current player's turn and switches to the next player. If the game is finished or if there are less than two players avaiable, no turn is set.

    • endGame

      public void endGame()
      Ends the game.

    • addChatMessage

      public void addChatMessage(ChatMessage chatMessage) throws InvalidNameException
      Adds a message to the chat: if the message is private, it will send only to the sender and to the receiver, if the message is global, it will be send to everyone.
      Parameters:
      chatMessage - The chat message to be added.
      Throws:
      InvalidNameException - If the receiver name is invalid.

    • leave

      public void leave(String id)
      Removes a player from the game. If the removed player owned the turn and if there are enough player, the turn is switched. You should check if the game have to be finished after this invocation.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the player to be removed.

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect(String id) throws GameFinishedException
      Disconnects a player from the game. If the removed player owned the turn and if there are enough connected player, the turn is switched. You should check if the game have to be finished after this invocation.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the player to be disconnected.
      Throws:
      GameFinishedException

    • reconnect

      public String reconnect(String id) throws AlreadyConnectedException, GameLeftException, InvalidIdException
      Reconnects a player to the game. If the current player isn't connected and there are more than one players, the turn is switched. You should check if the game have to be finished after this invocation.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the player to be reconnected.
      Returns:
      The name of the player that reconnected.
      Throws:
      AlreadyConnectedException - If the player is already connected.
      GameLeftException - If the player has left the game.
      InvalidIdException - If the ID is not valid.

    • checkTimer

      public boolean checkTimer(Long time, int numDisconnection)
      Checks if the time for a player to reconnect has expired.
      Parameters:
      time - The time at which the timer started.
      Returns:
      true if the timer has expired and the conditions are met, false otherwise.

    • getNumDisconnection

      public int getNumDisconnection()
      Returns the number of player disconnections that have occurred during the game.
      Returns:
      The number of player disconnections.

    • getLocal

      public LocalGame getLocal()
      Returns a LocalGame object representing the current state of the game.
      Returns:
      A LocalGame object representing the current state of the game.

    • getEventKeeper

      public EventKeeper getEventKeeper()
      Returns the event keeper object responsible for managing game events.
      Returns:
      The event keeper object.

    • isReady

      public boolean isReady()
      Checks if the game is ready to start. This means that the request number of players has been reached.
      Returns:
      `true` if the game is ready, `false` otherwise.

    • isFinished

      public boolean isFinished()
      Checks if the game has finished. This happens if is finished the last turn or if less than two players are left.
      Returns:
      `true` if the game has finished, `false` otherwise.

    • getNumPlayers

      public int getNumPlayers()
      Returns the total number of players request to start the game.
      Returns:
      The total number of players request to start the game.
